mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from Jennie Howard to Dr. Thomas H. Howard Postmarked Feb. 21st 1868
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A letter from Jennie Howard, postmarked Feb. 21st 1868, wherein she tells her brother in law Dr. Howard scandalous details about perjury in the trial of Bill Camp, who murdered her husband whom she refers to as "Dr." She explains that the clerk of court was Bill Camp's cousin, and that the jury was stacked with his relatives and those sympathetic to him. She says she will put the case before the military.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Courtship
Doctors
Family
Illnesses
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
